name: Grand Riviera Princess All Suites Resort & Spa

reviews.text: So to start off our review I would say that after booking this hotel and our first trip to Mexico we were worried after reading the trip advisor reviews. There is a mixture of good and bad reviews but those about safes being broken into and belongings being stolen are not something we were looking forward to. Anyway after a long flight we finally arrived and wow are the only words, this place is amazing. Long check in... Not for us 15 minutes and each family got the full low down on the resort including maps, towel cards and restaurant information.
reviews.title: No need to worry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms we booked junior suites are a great size and cleaned thoroughly everyday with the mini bar stocked daily. Buffet restaurants always had something on offer even for the most pickiest of eaters. In day 2 we booked in for the al a carte restaurants no problem at all and day 3 we booked again for the Italian which we found the best. Oriental was a bit confusing not sure if it was Chinese, Thai or Japanese or a mixture of all 3, food was edible though. The grill started off great but BBQ ribs uh oh not good. Ribs to me are grilled BBQ with sticky sauce not a boiled lump of meat but the starter and deserts were amazing! All the pools were well kept and clean we preferred the pool closest to the beach but often stopped by the party pool for a giggle during the day the drunken dancing in the jacuzzi is so funny bit like an American music video, winding down, women in tiny bikinis so funny but hey if that's not your thing you just find another pool there are plenty to choose from. The beach was lovely had no hassle from the vendors, a polite no is all that's needed. We hired jet ski's which were great fun. The sea although not crystal clear is very warm and you and go out some distance just take care on the few rocks. The resort is very large but we did not find this a problem or a 20 walk end to end as some have stated. We were staying by the hammocks and kids club and managed to walk to both lobby's within 10 minutes. The train runs very regular for those who would prefer not to walk but the resort is so beautiful it seems a shame not to walk around. 24 hour sports bar is great if u gave hungry teenagers, burgers, hotdogs, nachos and fried chicken not healthy but who doesn't like a treat now and again. I could honestly go on and on about the Riviera princess but all I will say is if u want sun, relaxation, happy friendly staff, clean and tidy surroundings and yes value for money the just book it!
reviews.title: Lovely vacation

reviews.text: Went to this hotel to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. Absolutely beautiful place. We stayed in the the Laguna villa. Really special treatment there. Alejandro was a wonderful concierge. He took special care of all the people in the villa. We had our own pool. At the pool we had a roped off area with plenty of lounges. Well worth the extra money. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The bed was comfortable.

reviews.text: A friend of mine stayed here in 2012 and recommended it as there was just so much they did for staying on one resort in one week. Deal was good, we saw that platinum was the best way to go so we shopped around online and got a good deal for it. Our experience with platinum was amazing and encourage anyone travelling here (especially from Canada) to choose platinum. The perks you get really give the price no justice - every penny is worth it.
reviews.title: A super holiday!!

reviews.text: For the first time in my life, I have never felt so spoiled and treated like a queen at a place like this resort. It is such a beautiful place and there is so much to do. Highlights of all:
reviews.title: Don't be put off by bad reviews !!! This place is amazing.

reviews.text: - We booked our hotel shuttle through the same website as we booked our trip and were hooked up with Best Day Travel Agency - hands down BEST PEOPLE EVER. They are pretty much the people you should go to when booking your excursions (you don't really have to book before you come as well, as they offer some really good prices and really can help plan out your week). They are excellent with ensuring that your transportation is on time, you are accounted for and you skip the entrance lines by getting your wristbands right at the hotel lobby. They are great at finding good and reliable places for you to do any activity you want (they are big on ensuring that your excursions are covered by insurance in case anything happens to you), so definitely check them out for all your questions. They are located behind the lobby's bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It’s taken me a week to write this review because my husband and I have been too depressed after our check out to think about it again. It is our little slice of paradise at this resort and the reason we have returned to it year after year is very simple, we have found nothing that compares! To give you some perspective on this review, we are both in our 40’s, childless and our goal is one to two vacations per year. Our summer vacation is normally 2 weeks in duration and a winter getaway 1 week, though we could very easily spend longer at the Princess! We have stayed at the Princess in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico several times previously and have ventured into Playa Del Carmen and Cozumel on a number of occasions while there. We don’t do the whole excursion thing anymore and tend to just relax and enjoy the surroundings of the resort. We’ve been to the Dominican Republic, Cuba, Grand Cayman, other areas in Mexico as well as the Southern Caribbean, South America and Asia. We know good hotel service and quality and this is it. Now on to the review for our most recent stay from July 12th-July 26th, 2013.
reviews.title: Grand Riviera Princess - Laguna Villa & Yucatan Section - Perfect Honeymoon, Anniversary, Couple Getaway!

reviews.text: We booked our stay for the Laguna Villa section of the resort but requested a room in the Yucatan (adults only) Section just to get a new experience under our belts. This allowed us access to the Laguna area which is tremendous but also gave us that new perspective which was also awesome! The Laguna Villa area is located at the front of the resort within a short walking distance of the front lobby, lounge, gift shop and the majority of the restaurants within the resort. The Laguna Villa is a private, adults only section that has a private pool, bar, concierge and walkway leading to the on-site spa. The landscaping is absolutely amazing and the area is always clean and inviting. With the black Laguna wrist band that you receive at check in you are allotted the use of the Laguna area as well as the remainder of the hotel, use of the concierge and bar, free Wi-Fi around the pool, in your room and at the Platinum building closest to the beach. You are also given access at the beach to the Platinum roped off area to the left of the central entrance. There is a mini fridge in your room that is restocked daily with water, pop, and beer and there will be a small mini bar selection for your use during the stay. Each room also has two bath robes and a pair of slippers for you to use and the bathroom is stocked with shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, a shower cap, a comb and soap.
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.text: Upon check-in you receive a voucher per person for a 30 minute relaxation massage at the spa and half day access to the spa indoor pool area. If you are looking to book a honeymoon, anniversary trip, or couples getaway; this is your VERY BEST option and I highly recommend it! The concierge Alejandro is a true professional with excellent English skills, a superior knowledge of the resort and is incredibly helpful. If you have questions once you arrive, just ask him. If you book at this area you are also able to take advantage of the order from the menu service at some of the buffets which saves you some time on those days that there may be a bit of a line up at the omelette station at breakfast or the pasta station at lunch. In addition, you are able to order room service free of charge to your room and I can tell you first hand that the burgers and chocolate cake are delicious!
reviews.title: positives and negatives for quick trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lastly, if you don’t wish to leave the Laguna area at lunch to go to one of the buffets, the lunch will come to you. The Laguna area has a small refrigerated crisper that is stocked daily with fruit, snacks, sandwiches and pastry. You will want for nothing in the Villas!
reviews.title: We had a great time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I explained above we actually had our room in the Grand Yucatan section of the Grand Riviera Princess. This area is located at the front of the resort directly beside the front lobby. It is a three story building, adults only with a private pool running the entire length of the area with swim out rooms on the ground floor, a private bar, and concierge services located in the front Platinum Lounge just a short walk away. We had a swim out room in the middle of the building just to the left of the bar area and with a really lovely view of the junglescape behind us. There were a number of iguanas, lizards, and coatis in the trees and beyond and listening to the birds every morning was a highlight of our day. It is a very relaxing, low key, adults only section of the resort that allows you to simply unwind, relax and enjoy. In this section you also have free Wi-Fi access in your room, on your balcony and at the Platinum building closest to the beach. You are also given access at the beach to the Platinum roped off area to the left of the central entrance on the beach. This is another great option if you are celebrating an anniversary, honeymoon or simply looking for a luxurious but affordable getaway with your significant other. There is a mini fridge in your room that is restocked daily with water, pop, and beer and there will be a small mini bar selection for your use during the stay. Each room also has two bath robes and a pair of slippers for you to use and the bathroom is stocked with shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, a shower cap, a comb and soap. You also get great room service free of charge in these rooms and don’t forget to try the chocolate cake, yummy!
reviews.title: Fab holiday with a few minor issues

description: Grand Riviera Princess All Suites Resort & Spa is located on the stunning Riviera Maya, just three kilometers from the famous Playa Del Carmen, in beautiful surrounds, with large and spacious natural parks and the delight of a good tropical weather. Besides our fascinating beach, renowned for the clear water and splendid sea beds, typical of the east end of the Yucatan Peninsula, the Hotel invites you to discover the huge wealth of the archaeological remains of the Maya culture in this area. After crossing the spacious lobby the splendid “Paseo de los Dioses” is reached, which invites the costumers to discover the charm of the hotel. It is a gift to our senses to enjoy all our facilities that can be found to our left and right on the way to the marvelous beach awaiting for everybody at the way of the pleasant stroll.Opened in December 2007, Grand Riviera Princess offers 674 fully equipped rooms with a range of services that give the clients a variety of possibilities to choose from: Junior Suite, Junior Suite Deluxe (some with direct pool access), Platinum Suites and Laguna Villa Suites (ideal for the most romantic honeymoon).A fascinating Spa is offered to all the clients, and the most complete activity program during day and night. A range of services in the varied and international selection of top quality food provide the perfect counterpoint when sharing moments of peace and calm with excellent meals in beautiful and inviting specially decorated surrounds, some of which are by the sea.
